title: Config options not copied over when --template-config-file used
body:
**Describe the bug**
<!--A clear and concise description of what the bug is and steps to reproduce it.-->
When I run `yarn run cli beacon init --template-config-file altona.json` (where altona.json is the one specified here: https://chainsafe.github.io/lodestar/usage/altona/), the resultant beacon.config.json just contains an empty object, `{}`

**Expected behavior**
<!--A clear and concise description of what you expected to happen.-->
I would expect the resultant beacon.config.json to contain all of the options contained in the altona.json

Can reproduce. The cause is that `options = mergeConfigOptions(options)` was removed from the `beacon init` command so it does not read those options before writing the config file.

It would be best to discuss first if we want to keep the template config file > config file workflow and how does it integrate with the run command. I believe we should not differentiate between a template config and a config file and get rid of the `init` command altogether.

The inital idea behind the different options and commands was as follows (things may have changed, this is the original conception):
- `init` will write a beacon configuration (+ other configuration files) to disk
  - the configuration it writes to disk is, by default, the default values of the Options
  - the `templateConfigFile` overrides any default values
  - cli flags (and env vars) can further override values
  - the `configFile`, in this `init` context, is the _output_ of the command. It isn't used as input, because the purpose of the `init` command is to create the config when it does not exist. Overriding this value sets the location of where to write the generated configuation.

- `run` will run the beacon chain with a configuration (+ other configuration files)
  - the default values are, by default, the default values of the Options
  - the `configFile` overrides any default values
  - cli flags (and env vars) can further override values
  - the `templateConfigFile`, in the `run` context, has no meaning. It isn't used because its purpose is simply as a _template_ for the config file written in the `init` step

My proposal is to refactor the process:
- replace `beacon init` command with `init` with the following responsibilities
  - initialize all configuration to disk (params (point 3 of https://github.com/ChainSafe/lodestar/issues/1155) + beacon configuration + other configuration files)
  - don't overwrite existing configuration, if it exists, check first and bail if it exists
  - support verbose logs
- rename `beacon run` command to `beacon`
- in every command other than `init`, if `init` has not been called yet for that `rootDir`, call it first (possibly suppress this w an explicit cli flag)
- `init` is left as a command that may be run explicitly, for the same reasons `beacon init` was separated from `beacon run` initially: to provide a step where sysadmins can verify/edit on-disk configuration files before running lodestar commands
- `templateConfigFile` is either removed entirely, or only exists as an _advanced option_ in `init` using the original semantics. If it remains, it is intentionally _only_ available as a flag in the `init` command, having no effect in any other command.
Init process / config file options have been reorg. Re-open if issue happens again
